Class LinuxCommunicator

  • java.lang.Object

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CanMapReadsToReferenceSequence
    public class LinuxCommunicator
extends OSCommunicator

    An OSCommunicator specific for Linux. Is able to create a multiple alignment.
    Author:
    Mauro Di Girolamo

    • Method Detail

      • mapReadsToReferenceSequence

        public void mapReadsToReferenceSequence​(java.io.File referenceSequenceFile,
                                        java.io.File readsFile,
                                        java.io.File outputFile,
                                        java.util.List<javafx.util.Pair<javafx.event.EventType,javafx.event.EventHandler>> eventHandlerList)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Runs a shell command to map reads to a reference sequence given a file with the reference sequence, a file with reads and an output file path. The shell command will be executed within a new thread. Please note that outputFile should not contain a file ending, since these will be added by the method, because two files with different file endings, .bam and .bai, will be created.
        Specified by:
        mapReadsToReferenceSequence in interface CanMapReadsToReferenceSequence
        Parameters:
        referenceSequenceFile - the file containing the reference sequence with file ending
        readsFile - the file containing the reads with file ending
        outputFile - the output file without file endings
        eventHandlerList - a list of handler to be added to the JavaFX Task
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • determineAmountOfCPUCores
